saphala_ekadashi.significance: Fulfillment of desires and wishes. A day for spiritual cleansing.

putrada_ekadashi.significance: Blessing of children and family prosperity.

shattila_ekadashi.significance: Use of sesame seeds for charity and blessings.

jaya_ekadashi.significance: Victory in all endeavors. Brings success and removes sins.

vijaya_ekadashi.significance: Conquering obstacles and enemies. Victory in all pursuits.

amalaki_ekadashi.significance: Worship of Amla tree. Health and longevity.

papmochani_ekadashi.significance: Removal of sins and past karma. Mental clarity and forgiveness.

kamada_ekadashi.significance: Fulfillment of desires and wishes. Removes obstacles.

varuthini_ekadashi.significance: Protection from evil and negativity. Shield of faith.

mohini_ekadashi.significance: Liberation from illusions. See truth clearly.

nirjala_ekadashi.significance: Most powerful Ekadashi! Waterless fast for ultimate spiritual merit. Equal to fasting on all 24 Ekadashis.

devshayani_ekadashi.significance: Lord Vishnu goes to sleep for 4 months. Beginning of Chaturmas.

kamika_ekadashi.significance: Fulfillment of wishes and desires. Worship Lord Vishnu with Tulsi leaves.

aja_ekadashi.significance: Protection for ancestors and family lineage.

parivartini_ekadashi.significance: Lord Vishnu turns to the other side during cosmic sleep.

papankusha_ekadashi.significance: Control of senses and mind. Inner discipline.

rama_ekadashi.significance: Devotion to Lord Rama and his ideals.

devutthana_ekadashi.significance: Lord Vishnu wakes from cosmic sleep! End of Chaturmas. Wedding season resumes.

utpanna_ekadashi.significance: Birth of Goddess Ekadashi from Lord Vishnu. Origin of Ekadashi.

mokshada_ekadashi.significance: Liberation and moksha. Fast for ultimate freedom from cycle of birth and death.

padmini_ekadashi.significance: Special Adhik Maas Ekadashi. Extra spiritual merit for devotion.

parama_ekadashi.significance: Sacred Adhik Maas observance for cleansing karma.

makar_sankranti.significance: Sun enters Capricorn. Harvest festival marking end of winter.

vasant_panchami.significance: Worship Goddess Saraswati. Spring arrives, celebrate knowledge and learning.

maha_shivaratri.significance: The great night of Lord Shiva. Marriage of Shiva and Parvati.

holi.significance: Festival of colors! Victory of devotion over evil. Spring celebration.

gudi_padwa.significance: Hindu New Year! Celebrate new beginnings and prosperity.

ram_navami.significance: Birth of Lord Rama. Symbol of dharma and righteousness.

hanuman_jayanti.significance: Birth of Lord Hanuman. Strength, devotion, and courage.

akshaya_tritiya.significance: Most auspicious day! Everything started today brings eternal prosperity.

nag_panchami.significance: Worship serpent deities. Protection and transformation.

guru_purnima.significance: Honor all teachers and gurus. Express gratitude for knowledge.

raksha_bandhan.significance: Celebrating the sacred bond between siblings.

janmashtami.significance: Birth of Lord Krishna at midnight. Celebrate divine playfulness!

ganesh_chaturthi.significance: Birth of Lord Ganesha! Remover of obstacles and giver of wisdom.

navratri.significance: 9 nights of Goddess Durga worship begin! Victory over evil.

maha_navami.significance: 9th day of Navratri. Worship Goddess Siddhidatri.

dussehra.significance: Victory of Lord Rama over Ravana. Good defeats evil!

karwa_chauth.significance: Married women fast for husbands' long life and well-being.

dhanteras.significance: Worship Goddess Lakshmi and Lord Dhanvantari. Wealth and health.

diwali.significance: Lord Rama returns to Ayodhya! Victory of light over darkness!

govardhan_puja.significance: Lord Krishna lifted Mount Govardhan. Celebrate nature's bounty.

bhai_dooj.significance: Celebrating the sacred sibling bond. Sisters pray for brothers.

chhath_puja.significance: Worship of Sun God. Devotion, purity, and gratitude to nature.

kartik_purnima.significance: Most sacred Purnima. Light diyas and take holy bath.

sankashti.significance: Krishna Paksha Chaturthi. Worship Lord Ganesha for removal of obstacles.

pradosh_vrat.significance: Trayodashi vrat dedicated to Lord Shiva. Pradosham occurs twice a month.

magha_purnima.significance: Magha Purnima. Holy bath and charity bring great merit.

pausha_purnima.significance: Pausha Purnima. Shakambhari Jayanti. Sacred day for fasting.

phulera_dooj.significance: Phalguna Shukla Dwitiya. Marks arrival of spring and Holi festivities.

holika_dahan.significance: Eve of Holi. Burn Holika effigy; triumph of devotion over evil.

ugadi.significance: Telugu/Kannada New Year. New beginnings and prosperity.

pongal.significance: Harvest festival of South India. Thanksgiving to nature.

sakat_chauth.significance: Magha Krishna Chaturthi. Mothers fast for children's well-being.

varalakshmi_vrat.significance: Worship Goddess Lakshmi for prosperity and family welfare.

tulasi_vivah.significance: Symbolic marriage of Tulsi with Lord Vishnu. End of Chaturmas.

dahi_handi.significance: Janmashtami celebration. Human pyramid to break curd pot.

pitrupaksha.significance: Fortnight of ancestors. Tarpan and Shraddha for departed souls.

lunar_eclipse.significance: Chandra Grahan. Auspicious for spiritual practices.

solar_eclipse.significance: Surya Grahan. Sacred time for meditation and donation.
